item.title: Sharon add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "Against my better judgment I feel certain that somewhere very near here—the first house down the road, maybe—there's a good poet dying, but also somewhere very near here somebody's having a hilarious pint of pus taken from her lovely young body, and I can't be running back and forth forever between grief and high delight." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "We have advantages. We have a cushion to fall back on. This is abundance. A luxury of place and time. Something rare and wonderful. It's almost historically unprecedented. We must do extraordinary things. We have to. It would be absurd not to." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "You invite things to happen. You open the door. You inhale. And if you inhale the chaos, you give the chaos, the chaos gives back." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Sharon add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Cronshaw stopped for a moment to drink. He had pondered for twenty years the problem whether he loved liquor because it made him talk or whether he loved conversation because it made him thirsty." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sharon add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "When I read a book I seem to read it with my eyes only, but now and then I come across a passage, perhaps only a phrase, which has a meaning for me, and it becomes part of me." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sharon add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "I always find it more difficult to say the things I mean than the things I don't." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sharon add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "I have an idea that the only thing which makes it possible to regard this world we live in without disgust is the beauty which now and then men create out of the chaos." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Sharon add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott
